casebody.data:
George T. Newhall, Respondent v. William H. Appleton, et al., Appellant. Decided June 27, 1890. Appeal from a judgment for the plaintiff entered on the report of a referee. William W. Badger, for plaintiff. Campbell & Paige, for defendants.

Before Freedman and Truax, JJ.

The only question involved was one of fact. The general term (Per Curiam) affirmed the judgment with costs.
